result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:31 PM Defendant Andrew N. Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for Andrew N. Ostrowski.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy and Robert Jambois in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court questions defendant's attorney.

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

10:31 AM Defendant Andrew N. Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Assistant District  Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 


ADA Jambois calls the case and states the appearances.
This is set for an Indigency Hearing.
Court will question the defendant with regards to the indigency hearing and then the court will hear his request for a bond modification.
10:33 a.m.  Defendant is sworn in.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant is informed that if he is appointed an attorney by the court that he would be responsible to repay the county.

Court moves on to the bond modification.
Court questions the defendant with regards to this bond modification request.
Defendant is informed that this is a recorded hearing and that he may wish to be careful as to what he states in the courtroom.
Defendant informed that he may want to have his court appointed attorney to assist him or waive his right to have his attorney be present.
Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel today for the bond modification.
Defendant makes additional statements.
ADA Jambois indicates that he did not know that this was on for a bond hearing.
Victims have not been notified of today's bond modification.
Defendant is informed that they will not be able to proceed with the bond hearing as the victim(s) have not been notified.
Bond hearing to be adjourned.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is determined to be partially indigent.
Defendant will be responsible to repay the county for attorney fees.
Court will sign an order appointing counsel.
Bond Hearing to be rescheduled.
Indigency hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

1:35 PM Defendant Andrew N. Ostrowski appeared by video in Waupaca County Jail. Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the Defendant if he hired an attorney.
Defendant states he has no funds to hire one.
Court will schedule a hearing to determine if the Defendant is eligible for a court appointed attorney.
BY THE COURT: Bond continues.
Defendant states he put in his request to have a bond reduction hearing.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

BY THE COURT:

Bond is continued

1:19 PM Defendant Andrew N. Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is not currently represented by an attorney.
Court questions the defendant if he is eligible for a state public defender.
Defendant states that he has equity in his home and is not eligible for a public defender.
Court questions the defendant if he has applied to the state public defender.
Ineligible for state public defender.
Defendant is informed to petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
Court questions the defendant if he is able to get this paperwork completed.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant to complete the county appointed paperwork either today or tomorrow.
Initial Appearance to be adjourned.
Bond is continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew N. Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody. 

Court reviews the file as to the status of an attorney. 
Defendant responds.  He spoke with Atty Sheets on Friday.  He is trying to get the funds for a retainer and believes that is likely to occur.  He did get the paperwork for a court appointed attorney as well.  It will take a week or two to come up with the retainer. 
Court reviews the file as to the bond modification request by the defendant. 
Atty Dodge receive the motion for bond modification and makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 

BY THE COURT:  Court does not take any action on the bond request and denies it today.  Defendant can renew it once he has counsel assisting him.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant is requesting a bond modification for $2,500

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew N. Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody from the Waupaca County jail. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states he called the public defender on Monday and was told he does not qualify.  He is trying to figure out how to get an attorney.    
Court questions the defendant regarding receiving the Petition for Appointment of Counsel.  
Defendant is waiting for the paperwork.  He is trying to contact Atty Sheets. 

Court will adjourn to see the status of counsel. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Defendant asks for a bond reduction.  
Court informs the defendant to send the request to Branch 1.  
Atty Pfeil asks the defendant to file the proper paperwork to address the bond reduction. 
Court addresses the defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Criminal Damage to Property, Battery, Felon Possession of Firearm, Bail Jumping, and 2nd Degree Sexual Assault, .
